intro: Staphidium brachystephanum, commonly known as the short-stephanum staphidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in dense clusters, making it attractive to pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
